A discourse of the nature and faculties, the effects and operations, the immortality and happiness of the soul of man -- A cordial against sorrow, or, A treatise against immoderate care for a man's own posterity, and grief for the loss of children -- Several epistles of the Reverend John Tillotson, D.D. and Dean of Canterbury, tending to the further illustration of the former arguments concerning the soul of man, and the proof of a particular providence over it.
